Minjun Kang

Contact: {firstname}.{lastname} [at] kaist.ac.kr

Room #211, N1 Bldg, KAIST.

I am currently a Ph.D. student co-advised by Prof. In So Kweon and Prof. Junmo Kim, in Electrical Engineering at Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology (KAIST). Previously, I earned my M.S. in Electrical Engineering from KAIST (Feb. 2021) and B.S. in Electrical Engineering from Korea University (Feb. 2019).

My research aims to effectively train deep neural networks under limited labels and data, such as long-tailed/biased labels and unlabeled data. Also, I have a broad interest in techniques for learning general representations and improving model’s robustness to distribution shifts, such as uni-/multi-modal representation learning, domain generalization, etc.

Publications

    Signing Outside the Studio: Benchmarking Background Robustness for Continuous Sign Language Recognition
    Yeong-Jun Jang,  Youngtaek Oh, Jae Won Cho, Dong-Jin Kim, Joon Son Chung, and In So Kweon
    In British Machine Vision Conference (BMVC), 2022.
    BIBTEX
  2. CVPR
    DASO: Distribution-Aware Semantics-Oriented Pseudo-Label for Imbalanced Semi-Supervised Learning
    Youngtaek Oh, Dong-Jin Kim, and In So Kweon
    In IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR), 2022.
    BIBTEX Project arXiv PDF Code
  3. FG
    KSL-Guide: A Large-scale Korean Sign Language Dataset Including Interrogative Sentences for Guiding the Deaf and Hard-of-Hearing
    Soomin Ham, Kibaek Park, YeongJun Jang,  Youngtaek Oh, Seokmin Yun, Sukwon Yoon, Chang Jo Kim, Han-Mu Park, and In So Kweon
